intro: Pseudosalacia streyi, commonly known as the Streyi's pseudosalacia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
